Socket pin type selection is a hotly contested personal choice.
Gold plate is less mechanically durable than tin, more corrosion resistant than the IC pins, and more expensive
Machined pins grip the pins more tightly, which is either considered a blessing or a curse, and cost more than folded sockets
The board aesthetically looks better if you use identical type sockets on the board, unless you're intentionally trying to highlight an area of the board.
In theory, you could use orange plastic sockets for the ECB interface, blue sockets for the memory decode logic...
